mxCell.value:
Flight irregularities
 (e.g., cancellation, delay,
 weather, mechanical) initiate
 the entire workflow.

Captures and validates all 
disruption-related data 
to create a unified master
 disruption record.

Analyzes affected passenger 
and ranks them by urgency 
using status,class,connections,
 and special needs.

Scans available seats 
across flights and
 partners to calculate 
real-time 
reaccommodation capacity.

If (Available Seats ≥ Affected Passengers)
 → Proceed to Direct Reaccommodation 
 Else → Trigger Optimization & Waitlisting

Engages partners, codeshares, and 
alternative transport/hotel options 
to boost capacity, then loops back to 
recheck availability.

Designs best-fit travel routes per 
passenger by balancing preferences
 with connection and operational constraints

Analyzes total reaccommodation cost,
 regulatory compensation, and upgrade
 trade-offs to assess financial impact.

Ensures all reaccommodation plans 
comply with aviation laws, documentation,
 compensation, and visa rules.

Validates if all options comply 
with regulations and uphold 
passenger rights.

Finalizes approved bookings, assigns
 seats, handles special requests,
 and coordinates interline tickets and waitlists.

Notifies passengers with new itineraries,
 handles queries, and manages updates 
across SMS, email, and app channels.

Manages hotels, meals, transport,
 compensation, and special assistance
 for disrupted passengers.

Marks successful reaccommodation—passenger
 is en route to final destination.

Continuously tracks system metrics 
and satisfaction scores to inform 
real-time capacity decisions.

Forecasts disruption impacts, 
no-show rates, and demand
 to guide smarter route optimization.

Audits key bookings, checks policy 
compliance, and escalates complex
 cases to ensure service quality.

Delivers outcome-driven insights, 
reports,and benchmarks to support
 strategic decision-making.
Tight connections (<90m), international transfers • Prevents cascade disruptions • Mandatory under aviation law • Highest operational impact prevention
Unaccompanied minors, disabilities, elderly (75+) • Legal safety obligations • Aviation regulation compliance • Duty of care requirements
Medical emergencies, military duty, bereavement • Humanitarian obligations • Contractual duty requirements • Life-critical travel purposes
Imminent visa expirations, entry permits • Avoids legal complications at destinations • Prevents immigration violations • Time-sensitive documentation issues
Missed cruises, hotels, return flights • Prevents collateral itinerary damage • Protects non-refundable bookings • Minimizes financial passenger losses
Families and corporate groups together • Prevents group fragmentation • Maintains traveling companion unity • Reduces collective dissatisfaction
Elite frequent flyer members • Platinum/Gold/Silver tier benefits • CRM-driven commercial priority • Long-term customer value protection
Premium cabin and full-fare passengers • Revenue protection strategy • Business/First class priority • Higher ticket value consideration
Hub-bound flights, crew positioning, efficiency • Airline-centric operational considerations • Minimal rerouting resource requirements • Cost optimization priority
Passengers with multiple recent disruptions • Compensatory priority for loyalty retention • CRM-driven customer satisfaction recovery • Lower operational urgency

• Priority 1-2: Critical safety and legal obligations (MUST handle first) • Priority 3-5: High regulatory compliance and passenger welfare • Priority 6-8: Medium operational and commercial considerations • Priority 9-10: Low priority commercial and efficiency factors • System processes Priority 1 first, then works down sequentially • Connection Criticality takes absolute precedence in all scenarios
